$interpreted: Nikola: (... Looks like I can't place the documents here anymore... Should I destroy them? But they are research papers I've devoted years to...)
Student: Mr. Nikola!
Nikola: How many times have I told you, no running inside the house!
Student: S, sorry...
Nikola: Sighs~ Forget it. Why are you here?
Student: It's class time already, but Mr. Hyde is still nowhere to be seen.
Nikola: Hyde very rarely does that... When's the last time anyone has seen him?
Student: I saw Mr. Hyde go into the mountains around noon.
Nikola: Hyde, what's the matter?

Hyde: I visited the mountains to find teaching materials for the students, then got ambushed by him...
... Took me quite the effort to kill him...
Nikola: This person... the bandit from last night? Why would he...
Hyde: I caught a glimpse of the documents in the compartment yesterday. The totem drawn on them are exactly the same as the mark on this person!
Nikola: Dracontines!?
Hyde: Beasts manipulated by a rune? Master, look out!
Hyde: Master, are you alright?
Nikola: Nothing serious. I'll be fine once I get some treatment back at the village...

Hyde: Those Dracontines, who exactly are they?
Why so intent on killing us?
Nikola: They are a group of people who swore to revive Sdorica and have been active in the shadows of history for many years.
Hyde: Revive Sdorica? Then what about the documents in the hidden compartment?
Nikola: These documents are my research on the mysterious runes used by the Dracontines back when I was still in the kingdom.
Nikola: It's too dangerous to keep them around after all. You must destroy them, now!
Hyde: Such intriguing patterns... Completely different than the runes we currently know...
Hyde: ... So Soul Energy can be driven and even further utilized using such a method!?
Nikola: ...... Hyde?
Hyde: Is this all of your research? Are there more? I still need more knowledge!
Nikola: Give me back the documents!
Hyde: Never mind. I shall continue on with this research.
Hyde: Of all the knowledge and wisdom I learned from you, not a single one is capable of curing my void disease.
Hyde: I was originally quite disappointed. Fortunately, I hit the jackpot at the very end!

Nikola: ... I get it. You're the one who manipulated the beasts with runes. That bandit is not a member of the Dracontines either.
It's all just part of your plans to deceive me!

Hyde: Don't talk like I'm the bad guy. I'm still very thankful for Master's teachings. The only problem is that you've hidden the documents way too well, 
leaving me with no choice but to use such lowly tactics.
Hyde: It appears that this is the end of our master-disciple relationship.
Hyde: Next, your blood will attract the nearby beasts. Then they will devour the now utterly powerless you until not a single piece of your body is left.
Hyde: This, is the future I saw...
Nikola: HYDE OUST!!
Hyde: I will treat all of this as an accident and report it as such to the villagers. I will inherit the school as well. No need to be concerned about that.
Hyde: Farewell, Master.
Villager Aunt: What a poor child. Are you alright?
Villager Old Man: There seems to be a clinic not too far away. We'll take you to the doctor, okay?
Child Hyde: ...... Bug off. You guys are not who I'm waiting for.
Villager Old Man: What did you say!?
Child Hyde: The person I'm waiting for is someone who can teach me expert knowledge that will allow me to respond to the future I saw.
Child Hyde: Not clueless peasants like you people!
Villager Aunt: What a rude brat! Dad, let's go. Leave him here to rot!
Nikola: A child beggar without a parent is it...
